oai_dc:dc.dc:title: George Earl Dunham
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Portrait of George Earl Dunham wearing a jacket, matching vest, collared shirt, and tie. A handkerchief is visible from his jacket pocket. He has a mustache and greying hair.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dunham Family Portrait
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Family portrait of the Dunham family, with George Earl Dunham sitting in the center. There are five men in the back standing, five men sitting in a middle row, and four men sitting with two women in the front. All men are wearing suits. The two women are wearing dresses of the era.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Marriage Certificate

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Erwin Portrait

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Architectural Assignment on the Whitestown Seminary
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Graded assignment that describes the delapidated state of the Whitestown Seminary and its history. Eleven pages are stapled together, including a form with typed answers, drawn diagrams, and polaroid photographs attached. The History of the Institute is a written report with the teacher's notes written in red. History includes citations to other works.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sullivan, John
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Education; Architecture;
